translate.value: Please revise your action. Are you sure you want to do this?
We didn't find the page you are looking for
Use this to link to somewhere else than a content object. Leave blank if linking to an object
This is the title of the link when a user hovers a link
Fill in a default value if needed. Seperate values with comma if on a select box.
Please fill in a search term
From here you can create new content. Each addon can add menu items here.
Manage your content from this menu.
You can search for content from this box.
This menu allows you to view your profile and logout.
Specific module menu actions can be done with this menu
Create and list content by type
Specific addon actions are listed here by addon
Whenever you upload a file for an item it is displayed here.
You need to login to use this feature
Choose a language file in .zip format
Child of an addon or a module.Activated when parent is active
Not allowed to edit this user group
Add a new user profile field
Maybe you followed an old link or you misspelled something
Login or Register for a Free PageLines Account
Logging in with your PageLines account will allow you to purchase items from the PageLines Store, and more.
Input full URL to your custom header or logo image
Input full URL to favicon image (favicon.ico image file)

Enter the full URL location of your custom favicon which is visible in browser favorites and tabs.
Must be .png or .ico file - 16px by 16px.
Places your Twitter feed in your site
This places your Twitter feed on the site. Leave blank if you want to hide or not use.
This hashtag will be used in social media (e.g. Twitter) and elsewhere to create feeds.
Having a hashtag can be useful in creating a common thread or feed in your social media efforts.
The image to use on your site's login page
This image will be used on the login page to your admin. Use an image that is approximately 80px in height.
Input full URL to Apple touch image (.jpg, .gif, .png)

Enter the full URL location of your Apple Touch Icon which is visible when your users set your site as a webclip in Apple Iphone and Touch Products. It is an image approximately 57px by 57px in either .jpg, .gif or .png format.
Show the title of pages above the page content
This option will automatically place page titles on all pages.
Hide default sidebars when sidebars have no widgets in them
This allows you to remove sidebars completely when they have no widgets in them.
Choose whether to show the sidebar wrap widgets on the top or bottom of the sidebar
You can select whether to show the widgets that you place in the sidebar wrap template in either the top or the bottom of the sidebar.
Select between responsive vs. static; pixel based or percentage based layout
Responsive layout adjusts to the size of your user's browser window; static is fixed width. Use this option to switch between the pixel based site width and a percentage based one.
The basic HTML layout structure for color and background effects

This option controls how the basic HTML layout is built. Different layout structures change the way background colors and images behave.
  • Full-Width Mode Full width design mode allows you to have aspects of your site that are the full-width of your screen; while others are the width of the content area.
  • Fixed-Width Mode Fixed width design mode creates a fixed width page that can be used as the area for your design. You can set a background to the page; and the content will have a seperate fixed-width background area (i.e. the width of the content).
Forces mobile devices to see the full site
By default PageLines accommodates mobile devices resolution and shows a mobile optimized view. Check this option to make it so users see your full site.
Two sidebars, one on each side

Select your default layout mode, this can be changed on individual pages.
Once selected, you can adjust the layout in the Layout Dimension Editor
The default layout for pages and posts on your site. Dimensions can be changed using the Layout Dimension Editor.

Configure the default layout sizes for your site, which is initially selected above in the Default Layout Mode.
This option allows you to adjust columns and margins for the default layout
Changes layout mode and dimensions back to default
The main layout colors for your site

Use these options to quickly setup the main layout colors for your site. You can use these options to build custom sites very quickly, or to quickly prototype a design then refine through custom CSS.

Notes:
  1. To make the background transparent, you can leave the options blank (delete text).
  2. Further customize and refine colors through custom CSS or plugins
Controls the color of text used throughout your site

These options control the colors of the text throughout the page or content area of your site.

Certain text types are designed to contrast with different box elements and are meant to be used with hover effects.

Experiment to find exactly how colors are combined with text on your site.
Enable Content Shadow (Fixed Width Mode Only)
Adds a shadow on the fixed width content area for a little style
Check this option to enable a drop shadow on the canvas area when using fixed width mode.
Setup a background image for the background of your site

Use this option to apply a background image to your site. This option will be applied to different areas depending on the design mode you have set.

Positioning Use percentages to position the images, 0% corresponds to the top or left side, 50% to center, etc..
Supersize The Background Image (Fixed Width Mode Required)
Uses a script to set the background for full width and responsive design
Sets the background to match the width of the browser.
Select and style your site's header tags (H1, H2, H3...)

Set typography for your h1, h2, etc.. tags.

* Denotes Web Safe Fonts
G Denotes Google Fonts

Note: These options make use of the Google fonts API to vastly increase the number of websafe fonts you can use.
The Pro version of this framework has over 50 websafe and Google fonts.
Select and style the standard type used in your site (body)

Set typography for your primary site text. This is assigned to your site's body tag.

* Denotes Web Safe Fonts
G Denotes Google Fonts
Select and style your site's secondary or sub title text (Metabar, Sub Titles, etc..)

This options sets the typography for secondary text used throughout your site. This includes your navigation, subtitles, widget titles, etc..

* Denotes Web Safe Fonts
G Denotes Google Fonts
Select and Style Your Site's Text Inputs and Textareas

This options sets the typography for general text inputs and textarea inputs. This includes default WordPress comment fields, etc..

This option makes use of the Google fonts API to vastly increase the number of websafe fonts you can use.
* Denotes web safe fonts
G Denotes Google fonts

Note: the preview pane represents the font in your current browser and OS. If developing locally, Google fonts require an internet connection.
Typekit is a service that allows you to use tons of new fonts on your site

Typekit is a new service and technique that allows you to use fonts outside of the 10 or so web-safe fonts.

Visit Typekit.com to get the script for this option. Instructions for setting up Typekit are here.
Use a special font replacement technique for certain text

Cufon is a special technique for allowing you to use fonts outside of the 10 or so web-safe fonts.

%s is equipped to use it. Select this option to enable it. Visit the Cufon site.
The font file used to replace text
Use the Cufon site to generate a font file for use with this theme. Place it in your theme folder and add the full URL to it here. The default font is Museo Sans.
Cufon: CSS elements for font replacement
Add selectors of elements you would like replaced
Use standard CSS selectors to replace them with your Cufon font. Font replacement must be enabled.
Checking this option will create drop down menus for all child pages when users hover over main navigation items.
Enable Shadow on Drop Down Menu?
Enable shadow for drop down navigation
Checking this option will create shadows for the drop down menus
Enable Arrows on Drop Down Menu?
Enable arrows for drop down navigation
Checking this option will create arrows for the drop down menus
Select Which Drop Down Options To Show
Nav Classic & BrandNav Section - Drop Down Handling
Enable drop downs and choose the options you would like to show
Remove the search field from the nav section
Removes the search field from the PageLines Navigation Section.
Control the location of the social icons in the branding section
Set the position of your header icons with these options. They will be relative to the branding section of your site.
Display the Blog RSS icon and link?
Places a news/blog RSS icon in your header
Display facebook Opengraph data in page header?
Places the special og: data in page <head> area.
Add social network profile icons to your header
Fill in the URLs of your social networking profiles. This option will create icons in the header/branding section of your site.
Use Child Pages For Secondary Nav?
Use this options if you want child pages in secondary nav, instead of WP menus
Control the number of columns per row in your footer columns section
Show a logo in the footer
Add the full url of an image for use in the footer. Recommended size: 140px wide.
Thanks for dropping by! Feel free to join the discussion by leaving comments, and stay updated by subscribing to the RSS feed.
Add a quick statement for users who want to know more...
This statement will show in the footer columns under the word more. It is for users who may want to know more about your company or service.
A line in your footer for terms and conditions text or similar
It's sometimes a good idea to give your users a terms and conditions statement so they know how they should use your service or content.
Choose between magazine style and blog style layout

Choose between two magazine or blog layout mode.

Magazine Layout Mode
Magazine layout mode makes use of post clips. These are summarized excerpts shown at half the width of the main content column.
Note: There is an option for showing full-width posts on your main posts page.

Blog Layout Mode
This is your classical blog layout. Posts span the entire width of the main content column.
Select how thumbs should be handled in full-width posts
Use this option to configure how thumbs will be shown in full-width posts on your blog page.
Additional information about a post such as Author, Date, etc...

Use shortcodes to control the dynamic information in your metabar. Example shortcodes you can use are:
  • [post_categories] - List of categories
  • [post_edit] - Link for admins to edit the post
  • [post_tags] - List of post tags
  • [post_comments] - Link to post comments
  • [post_author_posts_link] - Author and link to archive
  • [post_author_link] - Link to author URL
  • [post_author] - Post author with no link
  • [post_time] - Time of post
  • [post_date] - Date of post
  • [post_type] - Type of post
Select how thumbs should be handled in clips
Use this option to configure how thumbs will be shown in clips. These are the smaller magazine style excerpts on your blog page.
Additional information about a clip such as Author, Date, etc...

Use shortcodes to control the dynamic information in your metabar. Example shortcodes you can use are:
  • [post_categories] - List of categories
  • [post_edit] - Link for admins to edit the post
  • [post_tags] - List of post tags
  • [post_comments] - Link to post comments
  • [post_author_posts_link] - Author and link to archive
  • [post_author_link] - Link to author URL
  • [post_author] - Post author with no link
  • [post_time] - Time of post
  • [post_date] - Date of post
Full Width Posts (Magazine Layout Mode Only)
When using magazine layout mode, select the number of featured or full-width posts
Select the number of posts you would like shown at the full width of the main content column in magazine layout mode (the rest will be half-width post clips).
Where should the theme use post thumbnails?
Use this option to control where post featured images or thumbnails are used. Note: The post clips option only applies when magazine layout is selected.
Where should the theme use post excerpts when showing full column posts?

This option helps you control where post excerpts are displayed.

About: Excerpts are small summaries of articles filled out when creating a post.
Select Which Share Buttons To Show
Select which to show and configure appearance

Select which social sharing buttons you would like to use in your Sharebar.

Note: that since these use iFrames and javascript (provided by the companies themselves) they may be hard to style and control.
The link at the end of your excerpt
This text will be used as the link to your full article when viewing articles on your posts page (when excerpts are turned on).
In addition to single post pages and page templates, where should the theme place the full content of posts?
Choose where the full content of posts is displayed. Choose between all posts pages or just single post pages (i.e. posts pages can just show excerpts or titles).
Set the length of excerpts to something other than default
Excerpts are set to 55 words by default.
Control which tags are stripped from excerpts

By default WordPress strips all HTML tags from excerpts. You can use this option to allow certain tags. Simply enter the allowed tags in this field.
An example of allowed tags could be: <p><br><a>.

Note: Enter a period . to disallow all tags.
Include a Google JS script that fixes problems with IE
More info on this can be found here.
Adds pretty syntax highlighting for code.
Add a class of 'prettyprint' to code or pre tags, or optionally use the [pl_codebox] shortcode. Wrap the codebox shortcode using [pl_raw] if Wordpress inserts line breaks.
Change a your PageLines footer link to a PageLines affiliate link
If you are a PageLines Partner enter your link here and the footer link will become a partner or affiliate link.
Check this option if you are having problems with AJAX saving. For example, if design control or typography options aren't working
Add a special body class to this install of PageLines

Use this option to add a class to the >body< element of the website. This can be useful when using the same child theme on several installations or sub domains and can be used to control CSS customizations.
This information can be useful in the forums if you have a problem. %s
Minimum user level for Post/Page Meta Settings
Set userlevels for the different settings pages.
Members with a user level lower than the settings here will not be able to see the settings.
Minimum user level for Custom Post Types ( banners, features etc )

Insert custom CSS or LESS styling here. It will be stored in the DB and not overwritten.
Note: The professional way to customize your site is using a child theme, or customization plugin

Enter CSS Rules to change the style of your site.

A lot can be accomplished by simply changing the default styles of the body tag such as line-height, font-size, or color (as in text color).
Scripts inserted directly before the end of the HTML <head> tag
Any footer scripts including Google Analytics
Placeholder for Google asynchronous analytics. Goes just before </html> tag
Select the layout that will be used on this page
Control which sections appear on this specific page
Make it so mobile devices will see the full site, not the mobile optimized one.
The secondary widgetized sidebar for the theme.
A 3rd widgetized sidebar for the theme that can be used in standard sidebar templates.
Displays a widgetized sidebar inside the main content area. Set it up in the widgets panel.
The content you are looking for could not be found.
Use the information below or try to seach to find what you're looking for:
For creating boxes in box type layouts.
Basic setup options for handling of this box
More Link Text (Shows if link and text is set)
Applies a fixed navigation bar to the top of your site
Use this feature to add the NavBar section as a fixed navigation bar on the top of your site.

Use this feature to add the NavBar section as a fixed navigation bar on the top of your site.

Notes:
1. Only visible in Fixed Mode.
2. Image Height is constricted to a maximum 29px.
Select the color and theme of the NavBar
The NavBar comes with several color options. Select one to automatically configure.
Select the WordPress Menu for the NavBar(s)
The NavBar uses WordPress menus. Select one for use.
NavBar and Fixed NavBar Configuration Options
Control various appearance options for the NavBars
Applies text to NavBar on small screens. Not available on Fixed NavBar
Add text to the NavBar to serve as a title, but only displayed on small screens.
Use this sidebar if you want to use widgets in your footer columns instead of the default.
Text to display in the footer copyright section (%year% = current year, %blogname% = website name)
